t: To the chief Musician for the sons of Korah, A Song upon Alamoth.
God*p is our refuge and strength, a very present help in trouble.
Therefore*p will not we fear, though the earth be removed, and though the mountains be carried into the midst of the sea;
Though*p the waters thereof roar and be troubled, though the mountains shake with the swelling thereof. Selah.
There*p is a river, the streams whereof shall make glad the city of God, the holy place of the tabernacles of the most High.
God*p is in the midst of her; she shall not be moved: God shall help her, and that right early.
The*p heathen raged, the kingdoms were moved: he uttered his voice, the earth melted.
The*p Lord*s of hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our refuge. Selah.
Come,*p behold the works of the Lord,*s what desolations he hath made in the earth.
He*p maketh wars to cease unto the end of the earth; he breaketh the bow, and cutteth the spear in sunder; he burneth the chariot in the fire.
Be*p still, and know that I am God: I will be exalted among the heathen, I will be exalted in the earth.
The*p Lord*s of hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our refuge. Selah.
